description: This is a market on predicting the content of Nancy Pelosi's speech at the DNC.

markets.description:
Nancy Pelosi is scheduled to speak at the DNC Wednesday August 21.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Pelosi says "stock" during their main DNC speech. Otherwise, the market will resolve to "No".

If Pelosi does not give a speech at the DNC this market will resolve to "No".

Any usage of the word regardless of context will count toward the resolution of this market.

Pluralization/possessive of the word will count toward the resolution of this market, however other forms will NOT count (e.g. "stocks" would count).

Compound words will count as long as "stock" is part of the compound word and references the meaning which refers to the financial product which represents the ownership of a fraction of the issuing corporation.

The resolution source will be the video of the speech.
markets.question: Will Pelosi say "Stocks" at DNC speech?

markets.description:

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Pelosi says "Joe" or "Biden" 3 or more during their main DNC speech. Otherwise, the market will resolve to "No".

If Pelosi does not give a speech at the DNC this market will resolve to "No".

Any usage of the word regardless of context will count toward the resolution of this market.

Pluralization/possessive of the word will count toward the resolution of this market, however other forms will NOT count.

Compound words will count as long as "Joe" or "Biden" is part of the compound word and references the meaning which refers to US President Joe Biden.

The resolution source will be the video of the speech.
markets.question: Will Pelosi say "Joe" or "Biden" 3 or more times at DNC speech?

markets.description:
Nancy Pelosi is scheduled to speak at the DNC Wednesday August 21.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Pelosi says "January 6", "J6", or "Jan 6" or during their main DNC speech. Otherwise, the market will resolve to "No".

If Pelosi does not give a speech at the DNC this market will resolve to "No".

Any usage of the word regardless of context will count toward the resolution of this market.

Pluralization/possessive of the word will count toward the resolution of this market, however other forms will NOT count.

Compound words will count as long as "January 6", "J6", or "Jan 6" is part of the compound word and references the meaning which refers to the unrest at the Capitol on January 6, 2021.

The ordinal from of six, 'sixth', will count toward the resolution of this market.

The resolution source will be the video of the speech.
markets.question: Will Pelosi say "January 6" at DNC speech?
